intro: Protea lanigera, commonly known as the woolly protea, is a striking South African plant belonging to the Proteaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it its common name, and its large, showy inflorescence composed of numerous white to pinkish flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is typically found in coastal and mountainous regions. It is adapted to Mediterranean climates with wet winters and dry summers. Protea lanigera plays an important ecological role, providing nectar for various pollinators and supporting local biodiversity.
